item.title: Email sent to Lindy C. Ransom, Office Management Specialist at the U.S. Embassy in Beijing
item.description: Click on this link to visualize the original email: 2024-03-09_2058_0800_email_to_lindy_ransom_us_embassy_Redacted.pdf From: Vincent B. Le Corre Subject: FW: My call to the U.S. Embassy Legal Attaché Office Date sent: March 09, 2024, 20:58 +0800 (China Standard Time) To: Lindy C. Ransom (OMS at the U.S. Embassy, Beijing, China) Dear Ms. Ransom, I hope this message finds you well. I am reaching out to bring to your attention a matter of importance regarding the communications I have been sending to Ambassador Burns.

item.title: Happy Birthday, Mr. President
item.description: Click on this link to visualize the original email: 2023-12-21-1800-0100-happy-birthday-mr-president.pdf From: Vincent B. Le Corre Subject: Happy Birthday, Mr. President Date sent: December 21, 2023, 18:00 +0100 To: Emmanuel Macron Click on this link to visualize the original email: 2023-12-21-1800-0100-happy-birthday-mr-president.pdf Mr. President, Exactly five years ago to the day, on December 21, 2018, I registered the domain name Macron-Emmanuel.com to launch an unofficial website about you, Mr. President. My intention has always been benevolent. As I have done for other high-level officials and magistrates such as Nicole Belloubet, Cédric Villani, or François Molins, my aim was to raise public awareness not only of the serious crimes committed by the transnational criminal entity McDonald’s Corporation but also to highlight the recurring pattern of crimes of forgery and use of forged documents within the French judicial system.

item.title: ECTHRwatch submission
item.description: This page is currently empty and might be updated later. I first need to redact some information from what was submitted to the Court since the Court’s records pertaining to this case, V.L.C. v. France (50552/22) have been sealed. To gain a clearer understanding of the sequence of events in this case, I invite you to view a detailed timeline at the following link: https://www.ECTHRwatch.org/timeline/mcdonalds/ This timeline provides a comprehensive overview of the key milestones and developments.

item.description: From: Vincent B. Le Corre Subject: Open Letter to Ms. Desiree Ralls-Morrison Date sent: November 16, 2023, 23:15 (China Standard Time) To: Desiree Ralls-Morrison Dear Ms. Ralls-Morrison, I recently came across a LinkedIn post announcing your upcoming receipt of the CCWC 2024 Diamond Award of Excellence in Las Vegas at the Bellagio, as quoted by Ms. Laurie N. Robinson Haden. While many have extended their congratulations, I find myself in a position of contemplation rather than celebration.

Le Corre Subject: LeBron James and criminal RICO case targeting McDonald’s Corporation Date sent: May 31, 2023, 21:42 +0800 (China Standard Time) To: Donald Alway (Assistant Director in Charge, FBI) Cc: Vincent B. Le Corre My reference for this case: USA-v-McDonalds-pattern-of-racketeering-activity Dear Mr. Alway, My name is [REDACTED FOR PRIVACY]. I was born in [REDACTED FOR PRIVACY], on [REDACTED FOR PRIVACY]. I was notified on February 16, 2023, that the European Court of Human Rights (ECtHR) granted me anonymity.

item.title: My first communication, via LinkedIn, to Donald Alway, Assistant Director in Charge of the Los Angeles FBI Field Office
item.description: Click this link to see the original LinkedIn post. From: Vincent B. Le Corre Date sent: May 29, 2023, 08:50 +0800 (China Standard Time) To: Donald Alway (Assistant Director in Charge, FBI) Dear Mr. Don Alway, thank you for sharing the message of Director Wray. I watched it with genuine interest. I sincerely hope the FBI doesn’t underestimate the harm done by white-collar criminals. Director Wray omitted to mention financial crime but financial crimes often end up causing very significant harm to society including lots of premature deaths.

item.title: Chris Kempczinski, CEO of McDonald’s Corporation, is asked if Kevin Ozan’s departure is related to the criminal RICO case targeting them.
item.description: Click this link to see the original LinkedIn post. Dear Mr. Kempczinski, Is Mr. Ozan’s departure related to the criminal RICO case targeting McDonald’s Corporation and if yes, to which extent is it related? (look at the screenshot 👇 to understand) You also mention Mr. Ozan’s “unwavering integrity,” could you please confirm he reported internally my stern warnings about the crimes McDonald’s is engaging into? As the CFO, he obviously should have understood McDonald’s Corporation is engaging in money laundering, shouldn’t he?

item.description: From: Vincent B. Le Corre Date sent: May 2, 2023, 15:29 +0800 (China Standard Time) Cc: Nicolai Tangen (CEO of NBIM) Cc: Ida Wolden Bache (Governor of Norges Bank), Trond Grande (Deputy CEO of NBIM), Carine Smith Ihenacho (NBIM), Dag Huse (CRO of NBIM) Open letter/communication, submitted via a LinkedIn post, to Nicolai Tangen, CEO of Norges Bank Investment Management corporation, and CC’ed to various executives and the @FBI, in reply to his LinkedIn post whether “Can you spot the dragon?

item.title: LinkedIn post to Nicolai Tangen, Chief Executive Officer at Norges Bank Investment Management
item.description: Visualize the original post directly on LinkedIn by clicking this link. Dear Mr. Nicolai Tangen, This post will be published on McDStockInvestors (.) com which I created for the purpose of listing the notifications I send to investors in an entity you are currently financing through Norges Bank Investment Management. The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) is being actively notified (cc Jarrad Smith Adam Rogalski Mahonri Manjarrez). I also intend to notify Finanstilsynet (FSA Norway) when I have more time.

item.title: Trond Grande and Dag Huse are asked about Carine Smith Ihenacho’s email address
item.description: From: Vincent B. Le Corre Subject: Email address of the Chief Compliance Officer Ms. Carine Smith Ihenacho Date sent: April 6, 2023, 23:43 +0800 (China Standard Time) To: Trond Grande (Deputy CEO of NBIM), Dag Huse (CRO of NBIM) Dear Messrs. Grande and Huse, My name is [REDACTED FOR PRIVACY (note: but I of course gave them my real name)]. I attach a scan of my expired passport and my current Chinese driver’s license. I also attach the decision of the European Court of Human Rights to grant me anonymity for past, present, and future proceedings in respect to the case I am going to talk about.

item.title: Phone call to the FBI Victim Services
item.description: On February 15, 2023, I tried to call a phone number I found on an FBI brochure related to the FBI Victim Services. The phone number was (202)-324-3000. But the FBI operator hanged up on me. After the FBI informed me the FBI was recording the phone call, I informed the operator that I was also recording the phone call and he disagreed so he hanged up. To gain a clearer understanding of the sequence of events in this case, I invite you to view a detailed timeline at the following link:

item.title: Hunger Strike. Reply from French Law Professor Yves Strickler
item.description: Note: this email has been redacted for brevity. Check the French version of this page for the full content. Key point: French law professor Yves Strickler didn’t disapprove the possibility for me to do a hunger strike to protest the repeated violations of my fundamental rights by France. For the record, I am now accusing McDonald’s of having corrupted French officials. It might help to explain why McDonald’s France and McDonald’s Corporation, and their accomplices, have never been indicted for serious fraud and money laundering in France.

He confirms that my request for provisional admission to legal aid appears to be admissible. Moreover, he is surprised that I have not initiated summary proceedings in my employment case in which I was dismissed in 2010 for striking.

item.title: Phone call to the FBI Field Office of Washington D.C.
item.description: On December 17, 2015, I contacted the Washington D.C. FBI Field Office at +1-202-278-2000 to report the crimes committed by McDonald’s Corporation and their accomplices. The conversation lasted approximately 6 minutes and 35 seconds. Upon disclosing my location in China to the phone operator/intake agent, I was informed that the FBI could not take action as they lacked jurisdiction in China. However, this response seems to overlook the extraterritorial application of many American laws, suggesting a potential oversight in handling my report.

Date sent: 2015-10-30 at 22:25 +0800 (China Standard Time) To: Steve Easterbrook, Gloria Santona <Gloria.Santona@us.mcd.com>, Malcolm Hicks <Malcolm.Hicks@eu.mcd.com> Dear Mr. Easterbrook, dear Ms. Santona, and dear Mr. Hicks, I repeat again. Please stop the fraud. You must make it stop! I know you know this “game” is a fraud under European laws. You can not possibly be so stupid not to understand except if you don’t understand on purpose so that you can later claim plausible deniability.

Either he is dangerously incompetent, or he is complicit.

item.title: “I sold my soul to McDonald’s”
item.description: This book contains a crucial evidence that McDonald’s Corporation executives could have easily, through a simple phone call, stop the ongoing frauds which were happening in France, and later in Europe. Then, why didn’t they? In addition to the fact that there is an undeniable proof that, contrarily to what Gloria Santona said, this was a French problem, the book offers additional insights about how McDonald’s seems to corrupt politicians. To gain a clearer understanding of the sequence of events in this case, I invite you to view a detailed timeline at the following link:

From: Françoise de Borda (Francoise.deBorda@fr.mcd.com) To: Vincent B. Le Corre

If I recall correctly, a copy of the mail was sent to a French Ministerial Officer who I now accuse of being corrupted.

Translation coming soon. (Note of 2023-04-13: quick note, this event happened in 2012 and I published it, if I am not mistaken, on 2022-09-21T20:49:00+08:00. Back then I wrote “translation coming soon” but I currently don’t have time to translate what was said in French. It’s an important event but not that important compared to what I am currently explaining to the FBI which is the priority.)

Françoise de Borda, directrice juridique de McDonald’s France, me réponds pour la première et pour la dernière fois. Elle ment.

item.title: McDonald’s Corporation v. Simon Marketing 2002-09-16
item.description: Around January 2023, I found out that McDonald’s Corporation sued their supplier under RICO. It’s an important piece of evidence because it proves that when I would keep notifying, in 2015, McDonald’s Corporation, sternly warning them that they were committing fraud, they could only have immediately understood that the roles were now reversed: McDonald’s Corporation was now the criminal and they were engaging, via their subsidiary companies, in a pattern of racketeering activity. “MEMORANDUM OPINION AND ORDER
